docs.summary: Manage bookings, create, update and cancel bookings.

params.name: schedule
params.doc:
The selected schedule to book.
 Can be a specific session, or pre-defined schedule.

params.name: formInfo
params.doc:
Form filled information. Mandatory. contains contact details, participants, other form fields specified by the owner for the chosen service.
 Contact information. Mandatory. contains contact details, participants, other form fields specified by the owner for the choosen service.

params.name: couponCode
params.doc: Coupon code to apply for this booking

params.name: planSelection
params.doc: Describes the selected paid plan to use for this booking.

params.name: sendSmsReminder
params.doc: When value is set to True, an SMS reminder would be sent to the phone number specified in the ContactDetails, 24 hours before the session starts.

params.name: externalUserId
params.doc:
A user identifier of an external application user that initiated the book request.
 Allows an external application to later identify its own bookings and correlate to its own internal users

params.name: bookingSource
params.doc:
Identifies the source (platform, actor and app) that created this booking.
 This property of the booking can not be changed. It will be published in the BookingNotification callback for every update of this booking.
 The app_def_id and app_name will be resolved automatically.

params.name: flowControlSettings
params.doc: Sets the book flow behavior, some behaviors required permissions.

docs.summary:
Book a service.  
 Booking a service can be done by either of two methods:
 1. The booking is made by a customer.  
 2. The booking is made by business on behalf of a customer.  
  
 When the booking is done by the customer, the following takes place:  
 - Validation of the booking details according to the bookings policy and the service form mandatory fields.
 - Payment rules are applied. It can be creating a new order in Wix Payments, or redeeming the given paid plan.
   When online payment is required, the response contains the details of which the user of this api can complete the payment using Wix Payment Service.  
 - When booking an approval required service, The booking is not charged until it is confirmed by the business.  
   - BySessionId: The participant added to session is marked as PENDING until the booking is confirmed by the business.  
   - Slot: A new session is created with affected availability based on the configuration defined in the service policy.
 - When booking a service with Business Locations, if a business location is provided its Id will be validated to exist in the schedule's business locations.

 > **Permissions**   
 > This endpoint requires the Read Bookings - Public data or the Manage Bookings permission scope.  
 > With the Read Bookings - Public data permission scope, a customer booking flow is applied. 
 > With the Manage Bookings permission scope, a business 'book on behalf' flow is applied.

examples.title: Book an appointment

extra.description: Books an appointment by providing a session to create (if a location.businessLocation is provided, it must include a valid id)

examples.title: Book an existing session

extra.description: Books an existing session, by the session id. For example - book a class session.

examples.title: Book a set of sessions

extra.description: Books a schedule, that is a collection of sessions.

params.name: id
params.doc: The ID of the booking to be cancelled.

params.name: participantNotification
params.doc: Whether to notify the participants about the booking cancellation, and an optional custom message.

params.name: flowControlSettings
params.doc: Sets the cancel booking flow behavior.

docs.summary:
Cancel an existing booking.  
 Cancelling a booking causes the following changes:
 - The booking status changes `CANCELED`.   
 - The participant is removed from the session.  
 - If the booking was created from a slot as opposed to a session id or schedule id, the corresponding session that was created from the slot is deleted from the calendar.  
 - The participant is notified, according to the `participant_notification` properties.

 When `cancel` is invoked by a customer, the cancellation is validated against the service's bookings policy.
 If `cancel` is invoked by the owner, the service's bookings policy can be ignored by setting `ignore_cancellation_policy` to `true`.

 > **Permissions**   
 > This endpoint requires the Manage Bookings permission scope.

extra.description: Cancels a bookings

params.name: bookingId
params.doc: The booking identifier to pay.

params.name: couponCode
params.doc: optional. Coupon code to use. (cannot be used with a paid plan)

params.name: planSelection
params.doc: Paid plan to use.

params.name: notifyParticipants
params.doc: A field We pass forward when publishing a booking notification

params.name: lockedSessionKey
params.doc: optional. The locked session key.

params.name: flowControlSettings
params.doc: Sets the book flow behavior, some behaviors required permissions.

docs.summary:
Checkout a booking.
 When invoking `checkout` the following events occur:  
 - The availability of the requested slot/session/schedule is validated.  
 - The Booking is charged, by creating a new order in Wix Payment Service, or by redeem the given paid plan.  
 - (Can happen asynchronously) On payment complete and according to the request and the current booking's state,  
   A new session is created in the calendar, Or a participant is added to the selected session/schedule.  
 Note: In case the requested booked session is locked, the session key will be needed in order to Checkout the booking (see [Lock](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-bookings/bookings/availability/lock) endpoint).  

 > **Permissions**  
 > This endpoint requires the Manage Bookings permission scope.

extra.description: Checks out a booking

params.name: id
params.doc: The ID of the booking to be confirmed.

params.name: participantNotification
params.doc: Whether to notify the participants about the booking confirmation, and an optional custom message.

docs.summary:
Confirm a booking request.

 A service can be set to "Automatically accept all bookings when staff are available" or "Manually approve or decline booking requests" in the Online Booking Preferences page. When set to manual, the owner must confirm or decline each request.

 When invoking `confirm` the following events occur:
 - The booking status changes to `CONFIRMED`.  
 - The participant status in the session changes to `APPROVED`.  
 - Slot availability is updated.  
 - The booking is charged creating an offline order in the Wix Payment Service.  
 - A notification is sent to the participant according to the `participant_notification` properties.  

 > **Permissions**   
 > This endpoint requires the Manage Bookings permission scope.

extra.description: Confirm a booking which is pending. For example, a business owner confirms a booking that was done by a visitor and is pending his approval.

params.name: id
params.doc: The ID of the booking to be confirmed.

params.name: participantNotification
params.doc: Whether to notify the participants about the booking confirmation, and an optional custom message.

docs.summary:
Confirm a booking request.

 A service can be set to "Automatically accept all bookings when staff are available" or "Manually approve or decline booking requests" in the Online Booking Preferences page. When set to manual, the owner must confirm or decline each request.

 When invoking `confirm` the following events occur:
 - The booking status changes to `CONFIRMED`.  
 - The participant status in the session changes to `APPROVED`.  
 - Slot availability is updated.  
 - The booking is charged creating an offline order in the Wix Payment Service.  
 - A notification is sent to the participant according to the `participant_notification` properties.  

 > **Permissions**   
 > This endpoint requires the Manage Bookings permission scope.

extra.description: Confirm a booking which is pending. For example, a business owner confirms a booking that was done by a visitor and is pending his approval.

params.name: id
params.doc: The ID of the booking to be declined.

params.name: participantNotification
params.doc: Whether to notify the participants about the declined booking, and an optional custom message.

docs.summary:
Decline a booking request. 

 A service can be set to "Automatically accept all bookings when staff are available" or "Manually approve or decline booking requests" in the Online Booking Preferences page. When set to manual,  the owner must confirm or decline each request. 

 When invoking `decline` the following events occur: 
 - The booking status changes to `DECLINED`.  
 - The participant status on the session changes to `DECLINED`.  
 - The corresponding session or participant is deleted from the calendar.  
 - A notification is sent to the participant according to the `participant_notification` properties.  
 
 > **Permissions**   
 > This endpoint requires the Manage Bookings permission scope.

examples.title: Decline Booking

extra.description: Decline a booking in pending state. For example, a business owner declines a pending bookings request done by a site visitor.

params.name: id
params.doc: The ID of the booking to be declined.

params.name: participantNotification
params.doc: Whether to notify the participants about the declined booking, and an optional custom message.

 A service can be set to "Automatically accept all bookings when staff are available" or "Manually approve or decline booking requests" in the Online Booking Preferences page. When set to manual,  the owner must confirm or decline each request. 

 When invoking `decline` the following events occur: 
 - The booking status changes to `DECLINED`.

params.name: partySize
params.doc: Number of spots to check availability for.

docs.summary:
Returns the current availability of a requested entity.
 Based on the requested entity, validate there is enough spots left.  
 When invoking on a locked session, availability is False.  

 > **Permissions**   
 > This endpoint requires the Read Bookings - Public Data permission scope.

extra.description: Gets the provided session's availability

params.name: query.filter
params.doc: A filter object. See documentation [here](https://bo.wix.com/wix-docs/rnd/platformization-guidelines/api-query-language#platformization-guidelines_api-query-language_defining-in-protobuf)

params.name: query.sort
params.doc: Sort object in the form [{"fieldName":"sortField1"},{"fieldName":"sortField2","direction":"DESC"}]

params.name: query.paging
params.doc: Limit number of results

params.name: query.fields
params.doc: Projection on the result object - list of specific field names to return. If fieldsets are also specified, return the union of fieldsets and fields

params.name: query.fieldsets
params.doc: Projection on the result object - list of named projections. E.g. "basic" will return id and name fields. Specifying multiple fieldsets will return the union of fields from all. Specifying fieldsets and fields will also return the union of fields.

params.name: withBookingAllowedActions
params.doc: If true will return the allowed actions for each booking calculated using the business booking policy.

docs.summary:
Retrieves a list of bookings according to the provided filters and paging. By default, only confirmed bookings are returned. 
Query object support:
- **filter**: supports
 - `bookingId` - query for a specific booking.
 Example: ```"filter { string_value: "{ "bookingId": "46ce4cd4-46ff-4aa7-9cc0-02fd4f0f3209" }" }"```.
 - `contactId` - Bookings made by this contactId (defined in Contact service).
 Example: ```"filter { string_value: "{ "contactId": "b68960d3-820a-4588-a6b3-d7238add8af5" }" }"```.
 - `sessionId` - Bookings made to this sessionId. Support for a list of sessionIds;
 Example: ```"filter { string_value: "{ "sessionId": ["193ZPR9ppP9emJUCLevcLf6orynNE45", "193ZPR9ppP9emJUCLevcLf6orynNE98"] }" }"```.
 - `scheduleId` - Bookings made to sessions from this scheduleId, or made to the scheduleId itself. We support list of scheduleIds;
 Example: ```"filter { string_value: "{ "scheduleId": ["cd65b7de-164c-471b-908d-ee94d8ba6459", "fa573e37-e035-4bec-93b8-05cb90fe7aba"] }" }"```.
 - `startTime` - Bookings with booked entity (schedule/session) start time (UTC). We support 'gte' , 'lt';
 Examples:
 - All bookings that will start after or equal to `27/04/20 10:00:00` - ```"filter { string_value: "{ "startTime": {"$gte": "2020-04-27T10:00:00.000Z" }}" }"```.
 - All bookings that start before `27/04/20 10:00:00` - ```"filter { string_value: "{ "startTime": {"$lt": "2020-04-27T10:00:00.000Z" }}" }"```.
 - `endTime` - Bookings with booked entity (schedule/session) end time (UTC). We support 'gt' , 'lte';
 Examples:
 - All bookings that will start after `27/04/20 10:00:00` - ```"filter { string_value: "{ "startTime": {"$gt": "2020-04-27T10:00:00.000Z" }}" }"```.
 - All bookings that start before or equal to `27/04/20 10:00:00` - ```"filter { string_value: "{ "startTime": {"$lte": "2020-04-27T10:00:00.000Z" }}" }"```.
 - `status` - Bookings with this status. We support list of statuses.
 Example: "filter { string_value: "{ "status": ["CONFIRMED", "PENDING"] }" }".
 - `created` - Bookings creation time (UTC). We support 'gte' , 'lt';
 Examples:
 - All bookings that were created after or equal to `27/04/20 10:00:00` - ```"filter { string_value: "{ "created": {"$gte": "2020-04-27T10:00:00.000Z" }}" }"```.
 - All bookings that were created before `27/04/20 10:00:00` - ```"filter { string_value: "{ "created": {"$lt": "2020-04-27T10:00:00.000Z" }}" }"```.
- **paging**: Supported. Limit Example: "query { paging { limit { value: 10 } } }". Offset Example: "query { paging { offset { value: 10 } } }".
- **fieldsets**: not supported.
- **fields**: not supported. 

> **Note:** 
> - Only one use at a time of each filter once in the same query is supported. If a filter will be used more than once in one query, only the first occurrence is taken. 
> Calling List without any filter, will return all bookings permitted to watch by the invoker permission. 
> - All results are for one specific business, resolved from the request context. 
> - A Member can only see its own bookings; 
> - It is able to get the available actions for a member to do on each booking based on the business bookings policy using the with_booking_allowed_actions field. 

> **Permissions** 
> This endpoint requires the Read Bookings - Including Participants permission scope.

examples.title: List Bookings by id

extra.description: Returns a booking by the provided id, including the allowed actions on that booking.

examples.title: List Bookings for session

extra.description: Lists all Bookings done on the provided session id.

examples.title: List Bookings by time range.

extra.description: List all the Bookings within the given time range. In this example the business owner receives all the bookings done on the site in the given range.

params.name: sessionId
params.doc: The session ID to lock

docs.summary:
Lock a session for bookings.  
 When invoking this API with a sessionId, it returns a key that will enable to book the given session.  
 Once the session is locked -  
 Only the holder of the right key will be able to Book or Checkout.  
 Calling IsAvailable returns as not available.  
 Invoking Bookings.Book, Bookings.Checkout APIs without the right key will fail.  

 > **Permissions**   
 > This endpoint requires the Manage Bookings permission scope.

extra.description: Locks a session and return a key with which a booking on the session can be done.

params.name: bookingId
params.doc: Booking ID to update as paid.

docs.summary:
Mark a booking as fully paid.

 When the business has received full payment from the customer, the booking can be marked as fully paid.
 
 Invoking `MarkAsPaidRequest` the following events occur: 
 - The `paymentDetails.state` status changes to `"COMPLETE"`.
 - The `amountReceived` value is updated to the `finalPrice.amount` value.

 You cannot mark a booking as paid if the status is `"PENDING_APPROVAL"`.

params.name: withBookingAllowedActions
params.doc: If true will return the allowed actions for each booking calculated using the business booking policy.

docs.summary:
Retrieves a list of bookings according to the provided filters and paging. The query runs with the following defaults:
  - `"filter { string_value: "{ "status": "CONFIRMED" }" }"`
  - `"query { paging { offset { value: 0 } limit { value: 500 } } }"`
  - `"query {sort{ "fieldname":"created", "direction": "DESC" } }"`

  You can override these defaults, and define other filters and paging, as shown in the following table.

**Important**:
- Only one use at a time of each filter once in the same query is supported. If a filter will be used more than once in one query, only the first occurrence is taken.
  Calling Query without any filter, will return all bookings permitted to watch by the invoker permission.
- All results are for one specific business, resolved from the request context.
- A Member can only see its own bookings;

- It is able to get the available actions for a member to do on each booking based on the business bookings policy using the with_booking_allowed_actions field.

> **Permissions**
> This endpoint requires the Read Bookings - Including Participants permission scope.
Query object support:

 |Property|Filters|Description|Example|
 |--|--|--|--|
 |`bookingId`|`.eq`| Query for a specific booking. |`.eq("bookingId","46ce4cd4-46ff-4aa7-9cc0-02fd4f0f3209" }" }"`|
 |`contactId` | `.eq`| Bookings made by this `contactId`.| `.eq("contactId": "b68960d3-820a-4588-a6b3-d7238add8af5" }" }"`|
 |`sessionId`|  |Bookings made to this sessionId. Support for a list of `sessionIds`.|```"filter { string_value: "{ "sessionId": ["193ZPR9ppP9emJUCLevcLf6orynNE45", "193ZPR9ppP9emJUCLevcLf6orynNE98"] }" }"```.
 |`scheduleId`| |Bookings made to sessions from this scheduleId, or made to the scheduleId itself. We support a list of `scheduleId`s. | Example: ```"filter { string_value: "{ "scheduleId": ["cd65b7de-164c-471b-908d-ee94d8ba6459", "fa573e37-e035-4bec-93b8-05cb90fe7aba"] }" }"```.|
 |`startTime`| `.ge` , `.lt`|Bookings with booked entity (schedule/session) start time (UTC).| `.ge("startTime","2020-04-27T10:00:00.000Z")`|
 |`endTime`|`gt` , `lte`|Bookings with booked entity (schedule/session) end time (UTC).|Examples: All bookings that will start after or equal to `27/04/20 10:00:00` - ```"filter { string_value: "{ "startTime": {"$gte": "2020-04-27T10:00:00.000Z" }}" }"```.   All bookings that start before `27/04/20 10:00:00` - ```"filter { string_value: "{ "startTime": {"$lt": "2020-04-27T10:00:00.000Z" }}" }"```.|
 |`status`| |Bookings with this status. We support list of statuses.|Example: ` "filter { string_value: "{ "status": ["CONFIRMED", "PENDING"] }" }" ` |
 |`created`|'gte' , 'lt'|Bookings creation time (UTC).|Examples: All bookings that were created after or equal to `27/04/20 10:00:00` - ```"filter { string_value: "{ "created": {"$gte": "2020-04-27T10:00:00.000Z" }}" }"```.        All bookings that were created before `27/04/20 10:00:00` - ```"filter { string_value: "{ "created": {"$lt": "2020-04-27T10:00:00.000Z" }}" }"```.|
 |**paging**| |Supported. (`limit` default is 500, maximum is 2000) |`limit` Example: ` "query { paging { limit { value: 10 } } }" `    `offset` Example: ` "query { paging { offset { value: 10 } } }" `|
 |**fieldsets**| |Not supported.| |
 |**fields**| |Not supported.| |

extra.description: Returns a booking by the provided session id.
Returns a booking by the provided schedule id and created time.

params.name: bookingId

params.name: participantNotification

params.name: flowControlSettings
params.doc: Sets the reschedule flow behavior, some behaviors required permissions.

docs.summary:
Reschedule a Booking.  
 When rescheduling a booking of a slot, the session on the calendar is updated as well.  
 > **Note:** Rescheduling a booking to a schedule is not supported.  

 > **Permissions**   
 > This endpoint requires the Manage Bookings permission scope.

params.name: bookingId
params.doc: ID of the booking to be updated with attendance information.

params.name: attendanceInfo
params.doc: Attendance information for the booking

docs.summary:
Update a booking with the number of people who actually participated.
    
 The `numberOfAttendies` number can be less, equal to, or even more than the session object's `capacity` number.
 For example: When a class is defined with a maximum `capacity` of 20 people in the session object, and then 22 people actually attened. The session `capacity` is 20 and the booking's `numberOfAttendies` is 22.
 When invoking `set attendance` the following events occur:
 * `attendanceStatus` is set to true or false. True if people participated. False if no on showed up.
 * `numberOfAttendies` is updated to the number of people who actually participated.

params.name: sessionId
params.doc: The session ID to unlock.

params.name: key
params.doc: The locked session key.

docs.summary:
Unlock a locked session for bookings.  
 When invoking this API with a sessionId and its key, the session will be available for bookings.  

 > **Permissions**   
 > This endpoint requires the Manage Bookings permission scope.

extra.description: Unlocks a session.

permissions.name: Manage Bookings
permissions.description: Request permission to read, create and change the site's bookings, schedules, sessions and resources, including site owner data, staff member data, and participant data.

params.name: bookingId
params.doc: ID of the booking to be updated.

params.name: formInfo
params.doc: Updated form info and contact details

docs.summary:
Update the customer's information for a booking.

 `UpdateCustomerInfo` updates the customer's information for the specified booking. Note this does not update the information for the corresponding contact or member.
#corvid To update contact or member use [updateContact](wix-crm-backend/updatecontact) or [updateUserFields](wix-users-backend/updateuserfields)

permissions.name: Read Bookings - Including Participants
permissions.description: Request permission to read the business's bookings info, and its bookings with staff member and participant data.

members.name: numberOfAttendees

members.doc: Country code.

members.name: hint
members.doc: Free text to help find the address.

members.name: geocode
members.doc: Coordinates of the physical address.

members.name: countryFullname
members.doc: Country full name.

members.name: subdivisions
members.doc: Multi-level subdivisions from top to bottom.

members.name: streetAddress
members.doc: Street name, number and apartment number.

members.name: addressLine
members.doc: Main address line, usually street and number, as free text.

members.name: code
members.doc: Subdivision code. Usually state, region, prefecture or province code, according to [ISO 3166-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-2).

members.name: name
members.doc: Subdivision full name.

members.name: number
members.doc: Street number.

members.name: name
members.doc: Street name.

members.name: apt
members.doc: Apartment number.

members.name: latitude
members.doc: Address latitude.

members.name: longitude
members.doc: Address longitude.

members.name: id
members.doc: The ID of the form field as defined in the form.

members.name: value
members.doc: The value that was submitted for this field.

members.name: label
members.doc: The form field's label, as set by the owner, at the time of submission.

messages.name: customFormFieldsMapEntry
messages.displayName: custom Form Fields Map Entry Object

docs.summary:
Set of key-value pairs. Other custom field values that were specified by the user. In the form of field_id to value mapping.
 Deprecated. Is being replaced with additional_fields.

members.name: key:value
members.doc: `key` of type string, `value` of type string

members.name: contactDetails
members.doc: The contact details of the user making the booking.

members.name: paymentSelection
members.doc: A list of rates and the number of participants for each rate.

members.name: customFormFields
members.doc:
Set of key-value pairs. Other custom field values that were specified by the user. In the form of field_id to value mapping.
 Deprecated. Is being replaced with additional_fields.

members.name: additionalFields
members.doc: Additional custom fields submitted with the form.

members.name: contactId
members.doc: Contact ID.

members.name: firstName
members.doc: Contact first name.

members.name: lastName
members.doc: Contact last name.

members.name: email
members.doc: Contact email, used to create a new contact or get existing one from Contacts Service.

members.name: phone

members.name: address

members.name: fullAddress

members.name: countryCode

members.name: rateLabel
members.doc: The label corresponding to the booking rate. Default is free/custom.

members.name: numberOfParticipants
members.doc: The number of participants for this rate.

members.name: orderId
members.doc: The order ID when the Pricing Plan was purchased.

members.name: benefitId
members.doc: The benefit ID.

members.name: planId
members.doc: The ID of the pricing plan.

members.name: amount
members.doc: The required payment amount.

members.name: currency
members.doc: The currency in which the amount is quoted.

members.name: downPayAmount
members.doc: The amount of a down payment or deposit as part of the transaction.

members.name: id
members.doc: Checkout ID.

members.name: balance
members.doc: The final price, currency, down payment, and amount received.

members.name: paidPlanDetails
members.doc: Pricing plan details, if a pricing plan was used to pay for the booking.

members.name: couponDetails
members.doc: Coupon details, if a coupon was used to pay for the booking.

members.name: wixPayDetails
members.doc: Use wix_pay_multiple_details.

members.name: state
members.doc:
+ `COMPLETE` Amount paid in full.
 + `PENDING_CASHIER` An online payment is in progress and awaiting a response.
 + `REJECTED` The checkout request was rejected by the online payment process. 
 + `READY` All online checkout requirements were met. For example, when the service uses pay in person, or a partial or down payment was paid online.
 + `CANCELED`  Checkout cancelled.
 + `REFUNDED` When using Pricing Plans, if the booking was cancelled, it will be automatically refunded.
 + `PENDING_MERCHANT` An online payment was made, but the owner has not set up the necessary details.
 + `WIX_PAY_FAILURE` Online payment failure.
 + `PENDING_MARK_AS_PAID` Offline transaction. The transaction will be complete when explicitly marked as paid.
 + `PENDING_BUYER`  The transaction started, but is waiting for confirmation on the buyer's side. This can be due to credit or fraud checking on the provider's side, a long bank transfer, or similar processes.
 Checkout current state.

members.name: wixPayMultipleDetails
members.doc: In case of wix-pay service, holds all payment history for a booking.

members.name: finalPrice
members.doc:
The final calculated price.
 Calculated using the service's price, multiplied by the booking's number of participants, deducting any discounts or coupons.

members.name: amountReceived
members.doc: The current total amount paid.

members.name: orderStatus
members.doc:
+ `CREATED`  The transaction has been started.
 + `PENDING_MERCHANT` An online payment was made, but the owner has not set up the necessary details.
 + `COMPLETE`  The current part of the payment was completed.
 + `FAILED`  The Wix online payment system is unavailable or failed processing.
 + `DECLINED` The payment was declined.
 + `PENDING_MARK_AS_PAID` Offline transaction. The transaction will be complete when explicitly marked as paid.
 + `CANCELED` The transaction was cancelled.
 Transaction status

members.name: orderApprovalTime
members.doc: The date and time that the order was approved.

docs.summary:
Time periods that this location is open for business. Includes a collection of TimePeriod instances.
Aligned with https://developers.google.com/my-business/reference/rest/v4/accounts.locations#businesshours
With a few minor adjustments

members.name: periods
members.doc:
Times that this location is open. Each period represents a range of hours when the location is
open during the week. Limited to 100 time periods.

members.name: specialHourPeriod
members.doc: Exceptions to the business's regular hours.

docs.summary:
A span of time that the business is open,
starting on the specified open day/time and closing on the specified close day/time.
Closing time must occur after the opening time, for example later in the same day, or on a subsequent day.

members.name: openDay
members.doc: Day of the week this period starts on.

members.name: openTime
members.doc:
Time in 24hr ISO 8601 extended format (hh:mm). Valid values are 00:00-24:00, where 24:00 represents
midnight at the end of the specified day field.

members.name: closeDay
members.doc: Day of the week this period ends on.

members.name: closeTime
members.doc:
Time in 24hr ISO 8601 extended format (hh:mm). Valid values are 00:00-24:00, where 24:00 represents
midnight at the end of the specified day field.

docs.summary: Set of time periods when a location's operational hours differ from its normal business hours.

members.name: startDate
members.doc: Date and Time in 24hr iso-8601 Coordinated universal time (UTC)

members.name: endDate
members.doc: Date and Time in 24hr iso-8601 Coordinated universal time (UTC)

members.name: id
members.doc: The ID of the location

members.name: name
members.doc: Display name of the location

members.name: description
members.doc: Free text to better describe the location

members.name: default
members.doc:
Boolean that states the default location.
There can one default location per site, and changes on it affect on the Site Properties.
The default location can't be deleted and can be only marked through SetDefaultLocation api

members.name: status
members.doc: Status of the location. Active by default

members.name: locationType
members.doc: Type of the location

members.name: fax
members.doc: Fax number

members.name: timeZone
members.doc: Time zone

members.name: email
members.doc: Email address

members.name: phone
members.doc: Phone number

members.name: address
members.doc: Address

members.name: businessSchedule
members.doc:
Represents the time periods that this location is open for business. Holds a collection of TimePeriod instances.
TimePeriod indicates when the location is open. Each period represents a range of hours when the location is
open during the week. Limited to 100 time periods.

members.name: revision
members.doc: Location revision, represent the number of changes on the location

members.name: archived
members.doc:
Boolean that states if the location is archived.
Archived location can't be updated.

members.name: subdivision

members.name: hint

docs.summary: A break down of the street to number and street name

docs.summary: Address Geolocation

members.doc:
+ `OWNER_BUSINESS` The business address as set in the site’s general settings.
 + `OWNER_CUSTOM` The address as set when creating the service.

members.name: labeledPriceOptions
members.doc: Set of key-value pairs.Mapping between a named price option, for example, adult or child prices, and the price, currency, and down payment amount.

members.name: priceText
members.doc: Textual price information used when **Price Per Session** is set to **Custom Price** in the app's service details page.

members.name: platform
members.doc:
The platform from which a booking was created
 + `WEB` Desktop browser.
 + `MOBILE_APP` Mobile application.

members.name: actor

members.name: appDefId
members.doc: The appDefId or Wix site ID of the application that created this booking.

members.name: appName
members.doc: The name of the application that created this booking, as saved in Wix-dev-center at the time of booking.

docs.summary: The booking domain object

members.name: id
members.doc: The booking ID.

members.name: bookedEntity
members.doc: An object describing the entity that was booked.

members.name: bookedResources
members.doc: A list of booked resources. Currently, only one is supported. The booked resource would be the staff-member giving the session.

members.name: formInfo
members.doc: Form information submitted when booking. FormInfo contains contact details, participants, and other form fields, set up by the owner for the service.

members.name: paymentDetails
members.doc: Payment Details.

members.name: status
members.doc:
+ `PENDING_CHECKOUT` The booking is waiting to be checked out.
 + `CONFIRMED` The booking has beed approved by the owner.
 + `CANCELED` The booking has been cancelled.
 + `PENDING` The booking has been created.
 + `PENDING_APPROVAL` The booking is waiting for the owner to approve or decline.
 + `DECLINED` The booking was declined by the owner.

members.name: created
members.doc: Date and time when the booking was created.

members.name: attendanceInfo

members.name: externalUserId

members.name: bookingSource
members.doc: An object describing the platform and application that made the booking.

members.name: serviceId

members.name: title

members.name: location

docs.summary:
Booking Notification Event is sent upon having a Booking created or updated for various reasons.
 Reasons indicating a Booking is set and would reflect on the Business Calendar:
  OWNER_BOOKED - permitted user booked on behalf of UoU.
  VISITOR_BOOKING_CONFIRMED - UoU booking completed mandatory payment requirements and is now set.
  OWNER_CONFIRMED_BOOKING_REQUEST - permitted user approved UoU book request.
 Reasons indicating a Booking is updated:
  OWNER_RESCHEDULED_BOOKING - permitted user changed Booking via Reschedule API.
  OWNER_UPDATED_SESSION - permitted user updated the corresponding calendar session.
  OWNER_UPDATED_SCHEDULE - permitted user updated the corresponding service schedule, causing an update to one or more of the Booking properties.
  OWNER_CANCELLED_SESSION_IN_SET - permitted user canceled a session of the booked schedule. May affect Booking start/end.
  MEMBER_RESCHEDULED_BOOKING - UoU changed Booking via Reschedule API.
 Changes may include all or some of: time (start/end), location, booked resource, online conferencing.
 Reasons indicating a Booking is canceled:
  OWNER_CANCELED - permitted user either canceled the Booking via Cancel API or canceled the corresponding session/schedule.
  MEMBER_CANCELLED - UoU canceled the Booking via Cancel API.
 Reasons indication other kinds of updates:
  VISITOR_BOOKING_REQUEST_CREATED - UoU asked to Book a service that require permitted user approval (defined by the BookingPolicy.BookingsApprovalPolicy).
  OWNER_DECLINED_BOOKING_REQUEST - permitted user declined a Book request via Decline API.
  OWNER_UPDATED_ATTENDANCE - permitted user updated Booking attendance info.

examples.title: Visitor booking confirmed notification

extra.description: A visitor Booking to an Online Payment Appointment got fully paid and confirmed
Owner booked on behalf of a client.

examples.title: Owner updated attendance notification

extra.description: Owner mark booking attendance.

extra.description: Member rescheduled a booking.

examples.title: Owner canceled booking notification

extra.description: Owner canceled a booking.

members.doc: deprecated, use participant_notification

members.doc: in case of create this field is empty.

members.doc: Whether to notify participants about the change and an optional custom message

members.doc: relevant only on OWNER_UPDATED_SCHEDULE events

members.doc: When value is set to True, an SMS reminder would be sent to the phone number specified in the ContactDetails, 24 hours before the session starts.

members.doc: The set of field mask paths.

docs.summary: Describes a slot of time on the required schedules.

members.name: scheduleId
members.doc: The ID of the schedule that the slot belongs to.

members.name: start
members.doc: Slot start time.

members.name: end
members.doc: Slot end time.

members.name: requiredScheduleIds
members.doc: The schedule IDs of the required resources for which the availability will be checked. Returns true if at least 1 of resources' schedules has availability.

members.name: partySize
members.doc: Number of spots to check availability for.

members.name: sessionId
members.doc: The ID of the session whose availability is being checked.

members.name: scheduleId
members.doc: The ID of the schedule whose availability is being checked.

members.name: session
members.doc: The ID of the time slot whose availability is being checked.

members.name: bookingId
members.doc:
The ID of the booking whose availability is being checked. 
 Availability will be checked according to the schedule type of the booking (create_session, session_id or schedule_id). Availability will be `true` if the booking status is `CONFIRMED`.

members.name: available
members.doc: Whether the requested entity is available for booking for the specified party size.

members.name: capacity
members.doc: The number of spots available to be booked, not including the number of participants in the availability request.

members.name: totalNumberOfParticipants
members.doc: The current number of booked participants.

members.name: limit
members.doc: The number of items to load

members.name: offset
members.doc: number of items to skip in the current sort order

members.name: count
members.doc: The number of items returned in this response

members.name: offset
members.doc: The offset which was requested. Returned if offset paging was used

members.name: total
members.doc: The total number of items that match the query. Returned if offset paging was used and 'too_many_to_count' flag is not set

members.name: tooManyToCount
members.doc: A flag that indicates the server failed to calculate 'total' field

members.name: cursors
members.doc: Cursors to navigate through result pages. Returned if cursor paging was used

members.name: next
members.doc: Cursor pointing to next result page

members.name: prev
members.doc: Cursor pointing to previous result page

members.name: kind
members.doc: The kind of value.

members.name: nullValue
members.doc: Represents a null value.

members.name: numberValue
members.doc: Represents a double value.

members.name: stringValue
members.doc: Represents a string value.

members.name: boolValue
members.doc: Represents a boolean value.

members.name: structValue
members.doc: Represents a structured value.

members.name: listValue
members.doc: Represents a repeated `Value`.

members.name: fieldName
members.doc: Name of the field to sort by

members.name: order
members.doc: Sort order (ASC/DESC). Defaults to ASC

members.name: filter
members.doc: A filter object. See documentation [here](https://bo.wix.com/wix-docs/rnd/platformization-guidelines/api-query-language#platformization-guidelines_api-query-language_defining-in-protobuf)

members.name: sort
members.doc: Sort object in the form [{"fieldName":"sortField1"},{"fieldName":"sortField2","direction":"DESC"}]

members.name: paging
members.doc: Limit number of results

members.name: fields
members.doc: Projection on the result object - list of specific field names to return. If fieldsets are also specified, return the union of fieldsets and fields

members.name: fieldsets
members.doc: Projection on the result object - list of named projections. E.g. "basic" will return id and name fields. Specifying multiple fieldsets will return the union of fields from all. Specifying fieldsets and fields will also return the union of fields.

members.name: withBookingAllowedActions
members.doc: If true will return the allowed actions for each booking calculated using the business booking policy.

members.name: withBookingAllowedActions
members.doc: If true will return the allowed actions for each booking calculated using the business booking policy.

members.name: allowedActions
members.doc: Optional. Will return only when requested.

docs.summary: Possible allowed actions for a Booking

members.name: cancel
members.doc: Is cancel booking allowed

members.name: reschedule
members.doc: Is reschedule booking allowed

members.name: withBookingAllowedActions
members.doc: If true will return also the allowed actions for this Booking, for example, if Cancel is allowed for this Booking.

members.name: id
members.doc: Participant ID.

members.name: contactId
members.doc: Contact ID.

members.name: name
members.doc: Participant's name.

members.name: phone
members.doc: Participant's phone number.

members.name: email
members.doc: Participant's email address.

members.name: partySize
members.doc: Group or party size. The number of people attending. Defaults to 0. Maximum is 250.

members.name: approvalStatus
members.doc: Approval status for the participant. Generally the same status as the booking, unless updated using the `updateParticipant` API. Defaults to `"UNDEFINED"`.

members.name: inherited
members.doc: Whether the participant was inherited from the schedule, as opposed to being booked directly to the session.

members.name: scheduleId
members.doc: Schedule ID.

members.name: transparency
members.doc:
Sets a linked schedule's availability between the start and end of the session. Default is `"BUSY"`.
If set to `"BUSY"`, the schedule cannot have any available slots during the session. If set to `"FREE"`, the schedule can have available slots during the session.

members.name: scheduleOwnerId
members.doc: Owner ID, of the linked schedule.

members.name: title
members.doc: Synced title of the external calendar event.

members.name: description
members.doc: Synced description of the external calendar event.

members.name: timestamp
members.doc:
Unix epoch time.
Required if `local_date_time` is not specified.
If `local_date_time` is specified, `timestamp` is calculated 
as `local_date_time` for the business's timezone in epoch format.

members.name: localDateTime
members.doc: An object containing the local date and time, with no time zone.

members.name: timeZone
members.doc: The time zone.

members.name: year
members.doc: Year. 4-digit format.

members.name: monthOfYear
members.doc: Month number, from 1-12.

members.name: dayOfMonth
members.doc: Day in the month, from 1-31.

members.name: hourOfDay
members.doc: Hour of the day, in 24-hour format, from 0-23.

members.name: minutesOfHour
members.doc: Minute, from 0-59.

members.name: id
members.doc: Wix Calendar conference ID.

members.name: externalId
members.doc: Conference meeting ID in the provider's conferencing system.

members.name: providerId
members.doc: Conference provider ID.

members.name: hostUrl
members.doc: URL used by the host to start the conference.

members.name: guestUrl
members.doc: URL used by a guest to join the conference.

members.name: password
members.doc: Password to join the conference.

members.name: description
members.doc: Conference description.

members.name: conferenceType
members.doc: Conference type.

members.name: accountOwnerId
members.doc: Account owner id in vc service

members.name: scheduleVersion
members.doc: Schedule version number, updated each time the schedule is updated.

members.name: sessionVersion
members.doc: Session version number, updated each time the session is updated.

members.name: id
members.doc: Session ID.

members.name: scheduleId
members.doc: Schedule ID that the session belongs to.

members.name: scheduleOwnerId
members.doc: Owner ID of the schedule that the session belongs to.

members.name: originalStart
members.doc: Original start date and time of the session in Unix epoch time format.

members.name: start
members.doc:
An object specifying the start date and time of the session.
If the session is a recurring session, `start` must contain a local date/time.

members.name: end
members.doc:
An object specifying the end date and time of the session.
The `end` time must be after the `start` time and be same type as `start`.
If the session is a recurring session, `end` must contain a local date/time.

members.name: affectedSchedules
members.doc:
An object specifying a list of linked schedules and the way each schedule's availability is affected. A linked schedule is a schedule that has been associated with another schedule because there is a dependency between the two. This dependency affects the availability of both schedules. For example, the schedule of an instructor is linked to the schedule of the class that they instruct.
If the session is a recurring session, the value is inherited from the schedule but can still be overridden.

members.name: title
members.doc:
Session title. The default value is the schedule title.
If the session is a recurring session, the value is inherited from the schedule and cannot be overridden.

members.name: tags
members.doc:
Tags for the session. Optional. Defaults to the schedule's tags.
If the session is a recurring session, the value is inherited from the schedule and cannot be overridden.

members.name: location
members.doc:
An object describing the location where the session takes place.
Defaults to the schedule location.
For single sessions, `session.location.businessLocation` can only be provided for locations that are defined in the schedule using `schedule.location` or `schedule.availability.locations`.

members.name: capacity
members.doc:
Maximum number of participants that can be added to the session. Defaults to the schedule capacity.
If the session is a recurring session, the value is inherited from the schedule and cannot be overridden.

members.name: rate
members.doc:
The price options offered for the session.  Defaults to the schedule rate.
If the session is a recurring session, the value is inherited from the schedule and cannot be overridden.

members.name: timeReservedAfter
members.doc:
Time reserved after the session end time, derived from the schedule availability constraints and the time between slots. Read-only.
If the session is a recurring session, this field must be empty.

members.name: notes
members.doc:
Additional information about the session.
If the session is a recurring session, this field must be empty.

members.name: totalNumberOfParticipants
members.doc:
The number of participants booked for the session. Read-only.
Calculated as the sum of the party sizes.

members.name: participants
members.doc:
List of participants booked for the session.
The list includes participants who have registered for this specific session, and participants who have registered for a schedule that includes this session.
If the session is a recurring session, this field must be empty.

members.name: inheritedFields
members.doc:
A list of properties for which values were inherited from the schedule.
This does not include participants that were inherited from the schedule.

members.name: externalCalendarOverrides
members.doc:
Title and description values to override session defaults when syncing to an external calendar.
Learn more about [syncing calendars](https://support.wix.com/en/article/wix-bookings-important-information-about-syncing-google-calendars-with-wix-bookings).
If the session is a recurring session, the value is inherited from the schedule and cannot be overridden.

members.name: status
members.doc:
Session status.
 Possible values are:
 `"CONFIRMED"`: Default value.
 `"CANCELLED"`: 
    * The session was generated from a recurring session and then deleted.
    * The session was created as a single session and then deleted.
    * The session is a recurring session and was deleted.

members.name: recurringIntervalId
members.doc:
Recurring interval ID. Defined when a session will be a recurring session. read-only. Optional.
For exmaple, when creating a class service  with recurring sessions, you add a recurrence rule to create recurring sessions.
This field is omitted for single sessions or instances of recurring sessions.
Specified when the session was originally generated from a schedule recurring interval.
Deprecated. Use `recurringSessionId`.

members.name: recurringSessionId
members.doc: Recurring session ID, if the session is a recurring session.

members.name: type
members.doc: Session type.

members.name: calendarConference
members.doc:
A conference created for the session according to the details set in the schedule's conference provider information.
If the session is a recurring session, this field is inherited from the schedule.

members.name: recurrence
members.doc:
A string representing a recurrence rule (RRULE) for a recurring session, as defined in [RFC5545](https://icalendar.org/iCalendar-RFC-5545/3-3-10-recurrence-rule.html). 
The RRULE defines a rule for repeating a session.
Supported parameters are:

|Keyword|Description|Supported values|
|--|--|---|
|`FREQ`|The frequency at which the session is recurs. Required.|`WEEKLY`|
|`INTERVAL`|How often, in terms of `FREQ`, the session recurs. Default is 1. Optional.|
|`UNTIL`|The UTC end date and time of the recurrence. Optional.|
|`BYDAY`|Days of the week when the event should recur. Required.|`MO`, `TU`, `WE`, `TH`, `FR`, `SA`, `SU`|


 For example, repeat every second week on a Monday until January 7, 2022 at 8 a.m.:
`FREQ=WEEKLY;INTERVAL=2;BYDAY=MO;UNTIL=20220107T080000Z`

 <!--ORIGINAL COMMENTS:
  `FREQ` — The frequency with which the session should be repeated (such as DAILY or WEEKLY).  
 Supported `WEEKLY` value is supported.
  INTERVAL — Works together with FREQ to specify how often the session should be repeated. For example, FREQ=WEEKLY;INTERVAL=2 means once every two weeks. Optional. Default value is 1.
  COUNT — The number of times this event should be repeated. Not yet supported.
  UNTIL — The UTC date & time until which the session should be repeated. This parameter is optional. When it is not specified, the event repeats forever.
          The format is a short ISO date, followed by 'T' and a short time with seconds and without milliseconds, terminated by the UTC designator 'Z'. For example, until Jan. 19th 2018 at 7:00 AM: 'UNTIL=20180119T070000Z'.
  BYDAY - The days of the week when the event should be repeated. Currently, only a single day is supported. This parameter is mandatory.
       Possible values are: MO, TU, WE, TH, FR, SA, SU
       Note that DTSTART and DTEND lines are not allowed in this field; session start and end times are specified in the start and end fields.
       **Example**: FREQ=WEEKLY;INTERVAL=2;BYDAY=MO;UNTIL=20200427T070000Z
ORIGINAL COMMENTS-->

members.name: version
members.doc: An object containing the session and schedule versions.

members.name: scheduleId
members.doc: The ID of the schedule to which the slot belongs.

members.name: start
members.doc: The start time of the slot.

members.name: end
members.doc: The end time of the slot.

members.name: requiredScheduleIds
members.doc: IDs of other schedules that are also required.

members.name: partySize
members.doc: how many spots are required

members.name: forceInPersonCheckout
members.doc:
when defined as true, checkout the booking as "in-person" method, that doesnt required online payment.
 required BOOKINGS.MANAGE_PAYMENTS permission.

members.name: ignoreBookingWindow
members.doc:
when defined as true, skips the service defined booking-window in the booking policy.
 required BOOKINGS.IGNORE_BOOKING_POLICY permission.

members.name: skipAvailabilityValidation
members.doc:
when defined as true, skips availability check and allow to book.
 required BOOKINGS.OVERRIDE_AVAILABILITY permission.

members.name: skipBusinessConfirmation
members.doc:
when defined as true, allow to book instantly a confirmation-required service
 required BOOKINGS.IGNORE_BOOKING_POLICY permission.

members.name: schedule
members.doc:
The selected schedule to book.
 Can be a specific session, or pre-defined schedule.

members.name: formInfo
members.doc:
Form filled information. Mandatory. contains contact details, participants, other form fields specified by the owner for the chosen service.
 Contact information. Mandatory. contains contact details, participants, other form fields specified by the owner for the choosen service.

members.name: couponCode
members.doc: Coupon code to apply for this booking

members.name: planSelection
members.doc: Describes the selected paid plan to use for this booking.

members.name: sendSmsReminder
members.doc: When value is set to True, an SMS reminder would be sent to the phone number specified in the ContactDetails, 24 hours before the session starts.

members.name: externalUserId
members.doc:
A user identifier of an external application user that initiated the book request.
 Allows an external application to later identify its own bookings and correlate to its own internal users

members.name: bookingSource
members.doc:
Identifies the source (platform, actor and app) that created this booking.
 This property of the booking can not be changed. It will be published in the BookingNotification callback for every update of this booking.
 The app_def_id and app_name will be resolved automatically.

members.name: flowControlSettings
members.doc: Sets the book flow behavior, some behaviors required permissions.

members.name: sessionId
members.doc: The requested session id to book.

members.name: start
members.doc: The session start time. Used to validate the Business and Client time zone differences.

members.name: end
members.doc: The session end time. Used to validate the Business and Client time zone differences.

members.name: schedule
members.doc:
The selected schedule to book.
 Can be a specific session, or pre-defined schedule.

members.name: formInfo
members.doc: Contact information. Mandatory. contains contact details, participants, other form fields specified by the owner for the choosen service.

members.name: bookingSource
members.doc:
Identifies the source (platform, actor and app) that created this booking.
 This property of the booking cannot be changed. It will be published in the BookingNotification callback for every update of this booking.
 The app_def_id and app_name will be resolved automatically.

members.name: createSession
members.doc: Session to create and book.

members.name: scheduleId
members.doc: Schedule Id to book.

members.name: bySessionId
members.doc: Session Id to book.

members.name: id
members.doc: Id of the booking to be updated.

members.name: reschedule
members.doc: In case of rescheduling the booking, the new scheduling item to which the booking was rescheduled

members.name: updateAmountReceived
members.doc: Update the amount received

members.name: formInfo
members.doc: Update the form information, including the contact details describing the owner of this booking.

members.name: attendanceInfo
members.doc: Update the attendance information for this booking

members.name: notifyParticipants
members.doc:
Should notify participants - for now, relevant only on reschedule
 deprecated, use participant_notification

members.name: participantNotification
members.doc: Whether to notify participants about the change and an optional custom message

members.name: fieldMask
members.doc: Which fields to be included in this update. Currently only one field at a time is allowed.

members.name: createSession
members.doc: Reschedule to a new session that. This will create the session.

members.name: sessionId
members.doc: Reschedule to an existing session

members.name: scheduleId
members.doc: Reschedule to an existing schedule

members.name: bySessionId
members.doc: Reschedule to an existing session with start & end dates for validation

members.name: forceInPersonCheckout
members.doc:
when defined as true, checkout the booking as "in-person" method, that doesnt required online payment.
 required BOOKINGS.MANAGE_PAYMENTS permission.

members.name: skipAvailabilityValidation
members.doc:
when defined as true, skips availability check and allow to book.
 required BOOKINGS.OVERRIDE_AVAILABILITY permission.

members.name: bookingId
members.doc: The booking identifier to pay.

members.name: couponCode
members.doc: optional. Coupon code to use. (cannot be used with a paid plan)

members.name: planSelection
members.doc: Paid plan to use.

members.name: notifyParticipants
members.doc: A field We pass forward when publishing a booking notification

members.name: lockedSessionKey
members.doc: optional. The locked session key.

members.name: flowControlSettings
members.doc: Sets the book flow behavior, some behaviors required permissions.

members.name: ignoreCancellationPolicy
members.doc:
Whether to ignore the service's cancellation policy.
 Requires BOOKINGS.IGNORE_BOOKING_POLICY permission.

members.name: id
members.doc: The ID of the booking to be cancelled.

members.name: participantNotification
members.doc: Whether to notify the participants about the booking cancellation, and an optional custom message.

members.name: flowControlSettings
members.doc: Sets the cancel booking flow behavior.

members.name: id
members.doc: The ID of the cancelled booking.

members.name: id
members.doc: The ID of the booking to be declined.

members.name: participantNotification
members.doc: Whether to notify the participants about the declined booking, and an optional custom message.

members.name: id
members.doc: The ID of the declined booking.

members.name: id
members.doc: The ID of the booking to be confirmed.

members.name: participantNotification
members.doc: Whether to notify the participants about the booking confirmation, and an optional custom message.

members.name: id
members.doc: The ID of the confirmed booking.

members.name: ignoreReschedulePolicy
members.doc:
when defined as true, skips the service defined reschedule policy.
 required BOOKINGS.IGNORE_BOOKING_POLICY permission.

members.name: bookingId
members.doc: Id of the booking to be updated.

members.name: reschedule
members.doc: The new scheduling item to which the booking was rescheduled

members.name: participantNotification
members.doc: Whether to notify participants about the change and an optional custom message

members.name: flowControlSettings
members.doc: Sets the reschedule flow behavior, some behaviors required permissions.

members.name: createSession
members.doc: Reschedule to a new session. `affectedSchedules` is required

members.name: scheduleId
members.doc: Reschedule to an existing schedule

members.name: bySessionId
members.doc: Reschedule to an existing session with start & end dates for validation

members.name: bookingId
members.doc: ID of the booking to be updated.

members.name: formInfo
members.doc: Updated form info and contact details

members.name: bookingId
members.doc: ID of the booking to be updated with attendance information.

members.name: attendanceInfo
members.doc: Attendance information for the booking

members.name: bookingId
members.doc: Booking ID to update as paid.

members.name: booking
members.doc: Updated booking info.

members.name: skipOwnershipValidation
members.doc:
when defined as true, skip the booking-ownership check
 required BOOKINGS.MANAGE_BUSINESS_BOOKINGS permission.

members.name: id
members.doc: bookingId to get.

members.name: withBookingAllowedActions
members.doc: If true will return the allowed actions for the booking calculated using the business booking policy.

members.name: behaviorSettings
members.doc: Sets the flow behavior, some behaviors required permissions.

docs.summary:
Possible values are:
  • SHORT_TEXT - Short text. This is the default value type.
  • LONG_TEXT - Long text
  • CHECK_BOX - a text that represent the check box value: if selected the value is "true", otherwise "false".

Possible values are:
  • UNDEFINED
  • COMPLETE - Amount paid in full.
  • PENDING_CASHIER - An online payment is in progress and awaiting a response.
  • REJECTED - The checkout request was rejected by the online payment process.
  • READY - All online checkout requirements were met. For example, when the service uses pay in person, or a partial or down payment was paid online.
  • CANCELED - Checkout cancelled.
  • REFUNDED - When using Pricing Plans, if the booking was cancelled, it will be automatically refunded.
  • PENDING_MERCHANT - An online payment was made, but the owner has not set up the necessary details.
  • WIX_PAY_FAILURE - Online payment failure.
  • PENDING_MARK_AS_PAID - Offline transaction. The transaction will be complete when explicitly marked as paid.
  • PENDING_BUYER - The transaction started, but is waiting for confirmation on the buyer's side. This can be due to credit or fraud checking on the provider's side, a long bank transfer, or similar processes.

Possible values are:
  • UNDEFINED
  • CREATED
  • PENDING_MERCHANT
  • COMPLETE - This part of the payment was completed.
  • FAILED - cashier is unavailable or failed processing
  • DECLINED
  • PENDING_MARK_AS_PAID
  • CANCELED

Enumerates the days of the week. Possible values are:
  • MONDAY
  • TUESDAY
  • WEDNESDAY
  • THURSDAY
  • FRIDAY
  • SATURDAY
  • SUNDAY

For future use Possible values are:
  • ACTIVE
  • IN_ACTIVE

For future use Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN
  • BRANCH
  • OFFICES
  • RECEPTION
  • HEADQUARTERS

Possible values are:
  • UNDEFINED
  • OWNER_BUSINESS
  • OWNER_CUSTOM
  • CUSTOM

Possible values are:
  • UNDEFINED_PLATFORM
  • WEB
  • MOBILE_APP

Possible values are:
  • UNDEFINED_ACTOR
  • BUSINESS
  • CUSTOMER

Booking status. Possible values are:
  • UNDEFINED
  • PENDING_CHECKOUT
  • CONFIRMED
  • CANCELED
  • PENDING
  • PENDING_APPROVAL
  • DECLINED

Possible values are:
  • UNDEFINED
  • OWNER_BOOKED
  • VISITOR_BOOKING_REQUEST_CREATED
  • VISITOR_BOOKING_CONFIRMED
  • OWNER_CANCELED
  • OWNER_UPDATED_SESSION
  • MEMBER_CANCELLED
  • OWNER_UPDATED_SCHEDULE
  • OWNER_RESCHEDULED_BOOKING
  • MEMBER_RESCHEDULED_BOOKING
  • OWNER_UPDATED_ATTENDANCE
  • OWNER_CONFIRMED_BOOKING_REQUEST
  • OWNER_DECLINED_BOOKING_REQUEST
  • OWNER_CANCELLED_SESSION_IN_SET

`NullValue` is a singleton enumeration to represent the null value for the `Value` type union. The JSON representation for `NullValue` is JSON `null`. Possible values are:
  • NULL_VALUE - Null value.

Possible values are:
  • ASC
  • DESC

Possible values are:
  • UNDEFINED - Default.
  • PENDING - Pending business approval.
  • APPROVED - Approved by the business.
  • DECLINED - Declined by the business.

Possible values are:
  • UNDEFINED
  • FREE - The schedule can have available slots during the session.
  • BUSY - The schedule cannot have available slots during the session. Default value.

Possible values are:
  • UNDEFINED
  • EVENT - The session creates an event on the calendar for the owner of the schedule that the session belongs to. Default type.
  • WORKING_HOURS - Deprecated. The session type is working hours. Represents intervals masked as working hours in the schedule owner's schedule.
  • TIME_AVAILABILITY - Deprecated
  • AVAILABILITY - The session represents a resource's available hours.

Possible values are:
  • UNDEFINED
  • ONLINE_MEETING_PROVIDER - API-generated online meeting.
  • CUSTOM - User-defined meeting.

Possible values are:
  • UNDEFINED
  • CONFIRMED - The session is confirmed. Default status.
  • CANCELLED - The session is cancelled. A cancelled session can be the cancellation of a recurring session that should no longer be displayed or a deleted single session. The ListSessions returns cancelled sessions only if 'includeDelete' flag is set to true.
